commentary.revenue_performance: Revenues were flattish on a 12-month basis, but the 24-month growth was robust at 23%. Volume growth was 0.2% (flattish), but management noted market share gains.
commentary.profitability: Operating Profit grew 21% YoY to Rs 801 crores (18.3% of net revenue). Profitability was driven by **deflationary trends in palm oil and packaging**.
commentary.business_outlook: The company's strategy is to continue driving **market share**. Management is confident that growths will come back as the rural economy recovers.
commentary.key_challenges: The major reason for slow growth was **sluggishness in rural markets** and a high base (Q2 FY23 growth was 22%). Competition was increasing from local players taking advantage of softer commodity prices.
commentary.strategic_initiatives: The company commercialized its second factory in **Bihar** and continued to expand direct distribution to 27.3 lakh outlets. Innovation included Jim Jam Pops and Makhana (Better Snack Co).
commentary.market_conditions: Nominal growth was at 8% with low inflation at 0.2%. Global situation (Middle East, Russia) requires vigilance on commodity prices.
